content: all in one dinosaur stegosaurus amigurumi pattern by criss wall i have a huge collection of scrap balls of yarn i really wanted to use them instead of throwing them out i started crocheting small toys to leave around for people to find this is called random acts of crochet kindness raock if you were not familiar they turned out to be so popular i just can t stop making them i know that there are a few lovely dinosaur patterns out there already but i wanted a small pattern to add to my all in one collection this stegosaurus should take you around 20-30 mins to complete and is made all in one piece you can have a plain dinosaur or change the colours of the body and scutes spikes i would consider this an intermediate project but once you have crocheted a few of them they make up very quickly stitches us terms  chain chain  slip_stitch slip_stitch  single_crochet single_crochet  half_double_crochet half_double_crochet  increase increase  decrease decrease  double_crochet double_crochet treble in uk  bobble 4 double_crochet bobble in one stitch a normal bobble stitch made with 4 half worked double_crochet s 5 loops on your hook then pull through all of them do not chain 1 to close the bobble  picot for the top of the spikes on the dinosaur chain 2 and slip_stitch in the back bump of the first chain supplies  preferably two different colours of yarn one for the spikes and one for the body with a 3 5mm hook & 8ply/dk i use 3 5 metres 4 yards of yarn for the spikes and 10m 11 yards for the body  i don t like to add firm hook sizes to my patterns these little toys are most often made with scrap yarn that you have at home and you would use an appropriate hook size with it but as a guide i use 3 5mm for dk/8ply and 4mm for aran/10ply  optional 5mm or 6mm safety eyes but you can easily use a french knot or sew your eyes on later with this pattern the head is quite small and you need to check that the backs of the safety eyes will fit i don t have any issues with standard plastic safety eyes when i use a 3 5mm hook and 8ply yarn  hook scissors stuffing & a needle criss wall https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/all-in-one-dinosaur-stegosaurus instructions body work in the round without joining row you will need to keep track of the beginning and ends of the row for this pattern use a stitch marker or run a loose thread through the work the head and feet need to be placed in certain stitches to give the dinosaur the correct shape there is a photo tutorial after the instructions to assist row 1 using the body colour single_crochet 6 into a magic_ring 6 stitches row 2 *increase in every single_crochet* repeat around 12
